meanings.sent1: The tree's bark was suberose, feeling rough to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The cork had a suberose appearance, similar to the tree's bark.
meanings.sent3: The suberose surface of the cork made it difficult to write on with a pen.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a suberose quality, like the crackling of dry leaves.
meanings.sent5: The suberose texture of the cork reminded him of the rugged terrain of a mountain.

meanings.sent1: The suberose material of the bag looked like real cork.
meanings.sent2: The suberose pattern on the floor gave it a unique cork-like appearance.
meanings.sent3: She joked that his suberose hat made him look like a walking cork tree.
meanings.sent4: The suberose texture of the fabric felt like touching a piece of cork.
meanings.sent5: The suberose color of the wall reminded her of the natural tones of cork.

meanings.sent1: The suberose feel of the material was unexpected but pleasant.
meanings.sent2: The suberose texture of the fruit made it easy to grip.
meanings.sent3: He found the suberose touch of the fabric oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The suberose surface of the table reminded her of the feel of cork.
meanings.sent5: The suberose quality of the carpet made it comfortable to walk on.
